revised_title: Bills of Mortality in European Towns: A Statistical Analysis by Dr. Sprengell
tldr: Dr. Sprengell provides a detailed analysis of birth and death rates in various European towns, including Breslaw, Oels, St. Annaberg, Dantzig, Jauer, and Leipzig, during the year 1720. The study highlights the number of births, deaths, and baptisms, as well as mortality rates and demographic trends in these locations.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Demography
